title: Centralize and enforce fixed app name “Mobile Receipt” across UI and document title

requirements.summary: Centralize the app name as a single exported frontend constant and reuse it for all app-brand text and the document title across routes.
acceptanceCriteria: All visible app-brand text in the UI matches exactly “Mobile Receipt” (including Start page, mobile/desktop nav brand, and footer).
The HTML document <title> remains “Mobile Receipt” after navigation between routes.
There is a single source of truth (one exported constant) for the app name used by the above UI locations, rather than repeated hard-coded strings.

file_operations.description: Create and export a single source-of-truth constant (e.g., APP_NAME) whose value is exactly “Mobile Receipt”, to be reused anywhere the app name is rendered (UI brand text, alt text, and document title).
Replace hard-coded app-name usages with the centralized app-name constant for the Start page heading and the logo alt text (ensuring the visible brand text renders exactly “Mobile Receipt”).

Replace hard-coded app-name usages with the centralized app-name constant for mobile/desktop navigation brand text and logo alt text (ensuring the visible brand text renders exactly “Mobile Receipt”).

Replace the hard-coded footer brand text with the centralized app-name constant, and add route-change-safe document title synchronization (set document.title to the centralized app-name constant whenever the route/location changes).
Initialize document.title from the centralized app-name constant during app bootstrap to ensure the initial tab title is set from the single source of truth.

Remove the hard-coded “Mobile Receipt” from the static <title> so that the document title is set exclusively by the centralized frontend constant at runtime (keeping the runtime title exactly “Mobile Receipt”).
